result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to Reinstitute Proceedings

03:34 PM Attorney Maggie Hogan in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CM39 & 17CT82, Hogan statement to Defendant's non-appearance, does not have license, is available by phone. Not eligible for PD. Schiek statement to DPA extension. Court granted. Will appoint Hogan upon receipt of paperwork.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 10, 2019 at 03:30 pm.
Review hearing on March 25, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

1:39 p.m. Defendant Curtis E. Logan in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan states agreement. Plea questionnaire and Deferred Entry of Judgment State moves to amend Count 2 to a vioilation of 346.67, failure to aid - Granted. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Victim Impact Statements and Restitution Information provided. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists, accepts plea, defers entry of plea and accepts written agreement. Pfeifer/Hogan statement to DEJ in 15cm39 - Court extends agreement in that matter to January 30, 2019 at 3:30 p.m. Restitution to be taken from cash bond posted - remainder of bail to remain until end of case. Bail continued. Adj. 1:48 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for January 18, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 9:04 a.m. Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hogan statement. Pfeifer requests extension of DPA for 12 months to track with 17ct82. Court orders that by stipulation of parties DEJ is extended to time contemporaneous with agreement in 17ct82. Court requests that review hearing for both matters be held in Branch 1. Bail continued. Adj. 9:09 a.m.

4:45 p.m. Defendant Curtis E. Logan not in court.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cm39 and 11ct112. Sowinksi statement - intends to file motion to rescind - Court approves extension - Motion to be filed on/before Friday September 30, 2016.

3:30 p.m. Court Commissioner Galen Bayne-Allison. Defendant Curtis E. Logan in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement that he spoke with Attorney Hogan this morning - Defendant still does not have license - agreement has been reached that agreement be continued for 6 months - Defendant's statement to obtaining license - DOT has informed him there is a hold by Oneida County Child Support - waiting for release from child support, Adj. 3:36 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Deferred Entry of Judgment

02:09 pm - Defendant Curtis E. Logan in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 14ct112, 15cm39 and 15tr120.  State moves to dismiss 14ct112 and 15tr120 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to both counts in 15cm39.  Plea questionnaire and DPA filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists but defers judgment and accepts the DPA.  Bail continued.  Review hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Intra-Circuit Transfer
may not operate motor vehicle.

02:24 pm - Defendant Curtis E. Logan in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cm39 and 15tr120.    In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Schiek/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Intra-Circuit to BR II.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
